intro: Chavica benthamiana, commonly known as the bentham's chavica, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
